Submodules

yaw.encoders module

class yaw.encoders.JsonEncoder(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: JSONEncoder

A custom JSON encoder that can encode: - Sets - Datetime objects - Numpy datetime64 objects - Numpy ndarray objects - Objects registered with the PluginRegistrar

__init__(**kwargs)[source]

Initialize the JsonEncoder.

Parameters:

kwargs – dict: Additional keyword arguments extracting values from the ‘serializer_kwargs’ key and passing them to the base class. All other keyword arguments are passed to the corresponding Plugin.

find_plugin(obj)[source]

Find the plugin for a given object.

Parameters:

obj – Any: The object to find the plugin for

Returns:

Plugin: The plugin for the given object if its type is registered, None otherwise

encode(obj)[source]

Encode an object into a JSON string and ensure that tuples are not encoded as lists.

Parameters:

obj – Any: The object to encode

Returns:

str: The JSON string representation of the object returned by the base class

default(obj)[source]

The default method for the JSON encoder. This method pre-processes the object before encoding it.

Parameters:

obj – Any: The object to encode

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing the class name and encoded data string

class yaw.encoders.JsonDecodeHook(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

A custom JSON decoder hook that can decode: - Tuples - Sets - Datetime objects - Numpy datetime64 objects - Numpy ndarray objects - Objects registered with the PluginRegistrar

__init__(**kwargs)[source]

Initialize the JsonDecodeHook.

Parameters:

kwargs – dict: Additional keyword arguments are passed to the corresponding Plugin.

object_hook(obj)[source]

The object hook for the JSON decoder. This method post-processes the object after decoding it.

Parameters:

obj – Any: The object to decode if the object is a dictionary containing the class name and encoded data string

Returns:

Any: The decoded object

yaw.utils module

yaw.utils.deepcopy(obj: Any, exclude_keys: list | tuple | None = None, shallow_keys: list | tuple | None = None)[source]

Deep copy an object, excluding specified keys.

Parameters:

  • obj – Any: The object to deep copy

  • exclude_keys – Union[list, tuple]: A list of keys to exclude from the deep copy

  • shallow_keys – Union[list, tuple]: A list of keys to shallow copy

yaw.utils.get_default_args(fnc: Callable[[...], Any])[source]

Get the default arguments for a function.

Parameters:

fnc – Callable[…, Any]: The function to get the default arguments for

yaw.utils.match_args(args: list | tuple, kwargs: dict, src_args: list | tuple, src_kwargs: dict)[source]

Match and Substitute Arguments and Keyword Arguments using Specified Source Values.

Navigate through the provided args and kwargs, identifying entries prefixed with “$” and substituting them with values from src_args and src_kwargs respectively, to dynamically modify the function call parameters using the source values.

Parameters:

  • args –

    Union[list, tuple]: A list of arguments, potentially containing strings that indicate substitutable entries. Substitutable entries are prefixed with “$” and followed by either:

    • A digit (indicating an index to reference a value from src_args), or

    • Non-digit characters (indicating a key to reference a value from src_kwargs).

  • kwargs – dict: A dictionary of keyword arguments, where values might be strings indicating substitutable entries, similar to the entries in args.

  • src_args – Union[list, tuple]: A list of source arguments, intended to be referenced by substitutable entries within args.

  • src_kwargs – dict: A dictionary of source keyword arguments, intended to be referenced by substitutable entries within args and kwargs.

Returns:

Tuple[list, dict]: A tuple containing: - list: The new arguments, formed by substituting specified entries from args using src_args and src_kwargs. - dict: The new keyword arguments, formed by substituting specified entries from kwargs using src_args and src_kwargs.

yaw.utils.dynamic_module_import(modules: List[str], globals: dict)[source]

Dynamically import modules.

Parameters:

  • modules – List[str]: A list of module names to import

  • globals – dict: The globals dictionary to update

class yaw.utils.SingletonOptimized[source]

Bases: type

A singleton metaclass that is thread-safe and optimized for speed.

Source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/6798042

class yaw.utils.Plugin[source]

Bases: object

Base class for encoding and decoding plugins.

encode(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Encode data into a base64 string.

Parameters:

  • args – tuple: Additional arguments

  • kwargs – dict: Additional keyword arguments

Returns:

Tuple[bool, dict]: A tuple containing: - bool: True if the encoding was successful, False otherwise - dict: A dictionary containing:

  • ’__yaw__’: A tuple containing the class name and encoded data string

decode(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Decode a base64 string back into data.

Parameters:

  • args – tuple: Additional arguments

  • kwargs – dict: Additional keyword arguments

Returns:

Tuple[bool, object]: A tuple containing: - bool: True if the decoding was successful, False otherwise - object: The decoded data

class yaw.utils.PluginRegistrar[source]

Bases: object

Class for registering encoding and decoding plugins.

encoder_registry = {<class 'PIL.Image.Image'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.pillow_image.PILImage'>, <class 'collections.abc.Collection'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>, <class 'collections.abc.Container'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>, <class 'collections.abc.Iterable'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>, <class 'collections.abc.Mapping'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>, <class 'collections.abc.MutableMapping'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>, <class 'collections.abc.Sized'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>, <class 'mxnet._ctypes.ndarray.NDArrayBase'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.mxnet_tensor.MXNetTensor'>, <class 'mxnet.ndarray.ndarray.NDArray'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.mxnet_tensor.MXNetTensor'>, <class 'zarr.core.Array'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>, <class 'zarr.hierarchy.Group'>: <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>}
decoder_registry = {'AstropyData': <class 'examples.encoders.plugins.astropy_tables.AstropyData'>, 'MXNetTensor': <class 'yaw.plugins.mxnet_tensor.MXNetTensor'>, 'PILImage': <class 'yaw.plugins.pillow_image.PILImage'>, 'ZarrData': <class 'yaw.plugins.zarr_array.ZarrData'>}
static register(types=None)[source]

Register a plugin for encoding and decoding a specific type.

Parameters:

types – tuple: The type(s) to register the plugin for

static scan()[source]

Scan the plugins directory (YAW builtin and external) for plugins to register. This method is called automatically when the module is imported.
